pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Piece is an abstract class representing a piece on the chess board. It is implemented by other classes that are types of pieces such as King, Queen, etc.
    Author:
    Tim Remmert

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Piece(java.lang.String name, Player p)
      Initializes Piece with a given String for its name and a Player that it belongs to.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece(java.lang.String name,
             Player p)
        Initializes Piece with a given String for its name and a Player that it belongs to.
        Parameters:
        name - This is the String to be the Piece's name it should only be two characters.
        p - This is the Player the piece belong's to, it should only be either black or white.

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String s)
        Method to set a given piece name to the string parameter
        Parameters:
        s - This should only be two Characters long denoting the player and the piece type.

      • setPlayer

        public void setPlayer(Player p)
        Method to set a given piece Player to the Player parameter
        Parameters:
        p - - This is the player which the piece belongs to. It should either be black or white.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Method to get the name of a Piece
        Returns:
        name This is the name of the Piece

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()
        Method to get the Player which the piece belongs to
        Returns:
        player The Player the piece belongs to

      • getMoved

        public abstract boolean getMoved()
        Abstract method to get a boolean value to tell if a piece was moved yet or not in the game.
        Returns:
        Method returns false if the piece has not been moved and true if it has.

      • setMoved

        public abstract void setMoved()
        Method to set the moved value of a piece. If the value if false, it is set to true, and if the value is true it is set to true.

      • validPath

        public abstract boolean validPath(Board board,
                                  java.lang.String input)
        Method to determine if a users requested move is a valid move according to the rules of chess for that given piece
        Parameters:
        board - This is the board the piece is currently playing on
        input - This is the users requested move for the piece
        Returns:

      • toString

        public abstract java.lang.String toString()
        Method to set what is returned when a get method is called on the object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
